channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: After wild week, Trump looks close to full derailment
Trump pressures US FDA for Covid-19 silver bullet ahead of Election Day
Dr. Fauci: This is the good news
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci, director of the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious diseases, told CNN's Jim Sciutto that he does not think people should be concerned that politics are influencing the United States' Covid-19 vaccine timeline.

item.title: Even in the US, South Asians say caste has proved hard to escape
item.description: Sam Cornelius knew that something was amiss when his job performance review unexpectedly took a huge hit one year.

item.title: Beirut rescuers search site for possible survivor 30 days after explosion
item.description: Rescue teams in Beirut are digging deeper into rubble Friday where signs of life were detected 30 days after a massive explosion destroyed much of the city.

item.title: Journalist: Surveillance of poisoned Putin critic who is fighting for life was constant
item.description: Russian security services closely monitored Alexey Navalny's every step -- that's according to one former pro-Kremlin journalist who tells CNN he used secretly filmed footage to make documentaries on Russia's leading opposition figure. CNN's Matthew Chance reports how the security services watched Navalny in hotel rooms, restaurants and on holiday.

item.title: A White professor says she has been pretending to be Black for her entire professional career
item.description: A professor of African and Latin American studies who portrayed herself as Black has now revealed she has been lying.

item.title: 7 Rochester police officers suspended over Daniel Prude's death, mayor says
item.description: Seven police officers in Rochester, New York, involved in the March arrest of a Black man who was pinned to the ground and later died have been suspended, the city's mayor announced.

item.title: Man sought in Portland killing admitted to shooting right-wing activist
item.description: A Portland man who was killed Thursday night while authorities attempted to apprehend him appeared to admit he was responsible for the fatal shooting of a supporter of a right-wing group during clashes between pro-Trump groups and left-wing protesters in the Oregon city.

item.title: One dead as firefighters battle blaze aboard oil tanker off Sri Lanka
item.description: Firefighting crews from Sri Lanka and India are working to put out a large blaze aboard an oil tanker that has been burning since Thursday, off the coast of the south Asian island nation.

item.title: It's the worst disaster of the pandemic. But WHO chief says our lack of concern shows 'moral bankruptcy'
item.description: They are among the greatest victims of coronavirus, yet elderly people continue to be dismissed, despite growing evidence of the devastating effects the pandemic has had on them.

item.title: Trump mocks Biden for wearing a mask
Pelosi says she was 'set up' by hair salon owner
item.description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi responds to Republican backlash to her San Francisco hair salon visit, saying she was "set up" by the owner. CNN's Manu Raju reports.

item.title: Markets are flashing a big warning sign
As Hong Kong's academic year begins, it's unclear what can legally be said in a classroom
item.description: In the heart of the leafy, mountain-top campus of the Chinese University of Hong Kong stands a replica of a giant statue erected by protesting students in Beijing's Tiananmen Square in 1989, before a bloody crackdown by Chinese troops.

item.title: Europe may be too late to stop second wave as cases 'almost back' to March levels
item.description: Coronavirus cases in Europe are "almost back" to the levels seen in March when infection rates first peaked, scientists have warned as concerns grow over a potential second wave.

item.title: Who's standing up to Russia on Navalny poisoning? Not America
item.description: With the German government's announcement Wednesday of "unequivocal evidence" that the nerve agent Novichok was used in the poisoning of Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny, we are once again reminded how a vacuum in global leadership -- notably, in this instance, the silence of the American President -- can potentially open the way for the world's strongmen to reach for the deadliest means to silence their critics.

item.title: Barr's response to Trump's claim stuns CNN reporter
item.description: Attorney General Bill Barr appeared to support President Trump's unfounded claim that "thugs" on a plane were traveling to the Republican National Convention to do "big damage."

item.title: Massive mystery holes appear in Siberian tundra — and could be linked to climate change
item.description: A Russian TV crew flying over the Siberian tundra this summer spotted a massive crater 30 meters (100 feet) deep and 20 meters wide -- striking in its size, symmetry and the explosive force of nature that it must have taken to have created it.

item.title: R. Kelly's attorneys appeal for release, saying he hasn't been able to prepare for trial in nearly six months
item.description: R. Kelly's attorneys will ask for his release from federal custody before an appeals court on Friday, arguing that the singer has been unable to prepare for his upcoming trial for nearly six months.

item.title: The pandemic may have just killed overtourism
item.description: Let's journey back to a different time. One that feels far away. Early January 2020.

item.title: Son: 3 hospitals denied my dad before he died of Covid-19
item.description: Black, Latino and Native Americans are nearly three times as likely to be infected from coronavirus than White Americans and, as CNN's Jason Carroll reports, more likely to have tragic outcomes.

item.title: 'The Batman' production shut down due to Covid
item.description: Production on "The Batman," the forthcoming film starring Robert Pattinson, has been halted after a member of the production tested positive for coronavirus, according to Warner Bros. Pictures.

item.title: A house fire killed a firefighter's family while he was away battling a blaze
item.description: A firefighter battling a wildfire in Washington state near the Canadian border lost his wife and three children in an early-morning blaze that destroyed their new home.

item.title: 10 ways to conquer adult nightmares and get better sleep
item.description: We leave behind our fears of monsters under the bed as we say goodbye to our childhoods, but one can follow us into adulthood and loom over our heads.

item.title: A WWII prisoner's daughter learns her family's true story
item.description: Forty-one natives of the Alaskan Aleutian Islands were taken to and imprisoned in Japan during World War II. One of whom was Theresa Deal's mother. For years, Theresa thought she understood her mother's wartime history but now she knows the truth.

item.title: Trump angrily denies report that he denigrated US service members
item.description: President Donald Trump on Thursday forcefully denied a report in The Atlantic magazine that he had disparaged US service members killed in battle and chose to skip a ceremony honoring veterans.

item.title: The US is standing firm with Taiwan, and it's making that point very clear
item.description: When a United States guided missile destroyer sailed through the Taiwan Strait on Sunday, it marked the second such transit in less than two weeks -- and among the clearest signals yet of Washington's willingness to stand up for Taiwan in the face of Chinese aggression.

item.title: Facebook will let US politicians lie in ads through Election Day
item.description: In an attempt to combat efforts to undermine the US presidential election in November, Facebook on Thursday took several steps it says will address concerns about election interference on its platform.

item.title: Top doctor advises people to wear masks while having sex
item.description: Canada's chief public health officer is advising people to wear masks during sex and not to kiss anyone new.

item.title: 'No Time To Die' trailer is a wild ride around the world
item.description: The trailer for "No Time To Die" has dropped -- and the franchise looks better than ever.

item.title: Vast size of prehistoric megalodon shark revealed for the first time
item.description: The true size of a gigantic prehistoric megalodon shark that ruled the oceans millions of years ago has been revealed for the first time -- and it had teeth as big as hands, and a fin as tall as a human adult.

item.title: Muguruza delivers epic racket smash
item.description: Garbine Muguruza lost her racket and her US Open match Thursday against a tricky foe who returned to the circuit this week after becoming a mom.

item.title: How Somalia's pirates were stopped
item.description: Not so long ago, the coast of Somalia was plagued by pirates.

item.title: $10M 'dream coin' goes up for sale again
item.description: A rare 1794 Silver Dollar believed to be one of the first -- if not the first -- to be struck by the US Mint is going up for sale.

item.title: Pilots report man flying a jetpack above Los Angeles
item.description: An unusual call came into the Los Angeles airport concerning an unidentified man flying a jetpack. CNN affiliate KCBS/KCAL has the story.

item.title: Lili Reinhart 'feels like a prisoner' returning to 'Riverdale' set
item.description: Lili Reinhart is grateful for her gig on "Riverdale," but not thrilled about going back to work.

item.title: Rory McIlroy and wife Erica Stoll welcome baby girl
item.description: Rory McIlroy and wife Erica Stoll welcomed a baby girl into the world on Monday.

item.title: Messi's father confirms he's exploring option of remaining at Barcelona
item.description: Lionel Messi's father and agent has confirmed that he's exploring the option of the Barcelona talisman staying at the club for one more year.

item.title: PGA Tour 'expects to generate over $100m' towards racial and social injustice causes
item.description: PGA Tour commissioner Jay Monahan says that he expects the Tour to raise over $100 million towards racial and social injustice causes over the next 10 years.

item.title: Why new hotels are opening amid the pandemic
item.description: To say that Covid-19 has hurt the hotel industry, along with travel as a whole, is something of an understatement.

item.title: Pro ski champion lives double life as social media star
item.description: Balancing a career in professional sport with being a social media sensation is a tightrope to walk.

item.title: A drop in travel helps the planet. But there's a catch
item.description: With global travel largely on pause during the Covid-19 pandemic, some cities and companies see an opportunity to rethink tourism with the planet's health in mind.

item.title: The outrages, conspiracy theories and drama have clarified the personality clash with opponent Joe Biden and the issues that will decide the race
item.description: There have been many weeks when the Trump train has looked like it's going to jump the tracks. But in the seven days since the Republican convention, the President has come perhaps as close as he ever has to a full derailment.

item.title: Analysis: Trump accidentally reveals something big in tweet
item.description: • Analysis: After wild week, Trump looks close to full derailment • Trump pressures the FDA ahead of elections

item.title: Analysis: Here's what to know as mail-in voting begins
item.description: The 2020 presidential election has officially started.

item.title: Carter affirms safety of mail-in voting after Barr and White House cite him to diminish it
item.description: Jimmy Carter is pushing back on efforts by Attorney General William Barr and the White House to use the former Democratic president's work studying voting by mail to discredit the practice.

item.title: Voter: It's obvious what a future with Trump looks like
item.description: President Donald Trump claims Democrats will destroy the American suburbs, so CNN went to the battleground state of Ohio to gauge whether that message is resonating. CNN's Jeff Zeleny reports the President's message has been a turnoff for some.

item.title: Russia channels Trump's false claims about mail-in voting
item.description: An intelligence bulletin issued by the Department of Homeland Security warns that Russia is attempting to sow doubt about the integrity of the 2020 elections by amplifying false claims that mail-in voting will result in widespread fraud, an assertion that has been repeatedly pushed by President Donald Trump, according to a congressional source with direct knowledge of the document who confirmed its veracity.

item.title: Second sailor found as search for missing cattle ship continues
item.description: A second crew member has been found floating unconscious in the waters off Japan after a cargo ship with 43 people and almost 6,000 cows aboard went missing during Typhoon Maysak, according to the Japan Coast Guard.
